entry.title: PPLNS with job declaration
entry.summary:
The discussion revolves around the operational dynamics of the Joint Distribution Service (JDS) when considered as an independent entity, especially in relation to different mining pools. It's highlighted that for effective functioning, there is a necessity for each pool to communicate its coinbase outputs directly to the JDS. Furthermore, it's imperative for miners to explicitly inform the JDS about which pool they are contributing to. This requirement stems from the need for clarity and accountability in the distribution process, ensuring that rewards are accurately allocated based on the contributions and affiliations of the miners.
Aside from these specific communication requirements, the email suggests that the JDS would continue to operate similarly to its current implementation within the Shared Rewards Initiative (SRI). This implies that while certain procedural aspects related to communication and data sharing would need adjustments, the core mechanisms and principles guiding the JDS's operations would remain consistent with existing practices. The emphasis on direct communication underscores the importance of transparency and efficiency in managing distributions among various stakeholders within the mining ecosystem.
